item.title: Don’t use Git to Deploy Code
item.description:
Just don’t. If you can’t reason why, please stop developing code critical to your business.

When it works, it works

Git is great. Push here, pull there. It works so well that you might be fatuously convinced it’s the perfect tool to deploy production code. Even worse, it might appear to work well at this task, further reinforcing your choice  However, the Achilles Heel of any DVCS is your origin provider. Let’s say that BitBucket has borked their database for the 4th time this month or GitHub is suffering yet another DDNS attack. Then we see posts opining about failed Git based app deployments.
